div.head: {left margin} María Soledad
div.p: In this parish of San Jerónimo de Taos on the fifth day of the month of November of the year one thousand eight hundred and forty-five: Having already carried out the necessary catechisms for the instruction of an adult, and having found her sufficiently instructed in the principles, means, and ends of our religion, as well as determined to be baptized for her own honest motives that should [ILL], I, parish priest Don Antonio José Martínez, solemnly exorcised, placed holy oils, baptized, and anointed with sacred chrism an adult, about twenty years old, according to the rite that Our Holy Mother Church prescribes for the baptism of adults. She is a descendant of the Ute tribe from which she was rescued, servant of Don Charles Beaubien and Doña María Paula Lobato, residents of the town of Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe.
